page.title: 13Fashion in School
page.content: School Fashion, although not completely in tune with Street Fashions, frequently change. In 1982 tight minis were 'IN'. Ties were large, any knot smaller than a fist was called a 'Swot Knot'. Hair was short and spiked. The idea was to look as far from neat and tidy as possible, for boys, fashion was not in fashion. The only thing that really caught on were skin tight 'Staypress' which looked somewhat like shapeless pyjamas. The shoe scene is pretty much the same. Girls are still favouring Court shoes with varying heights of stilleto heels. In 1982 Track shoes and Trainers figured most in the life of a male teenage foot.
